turns.speaker: SEER
turns.text: Can you see?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Yes. It is the Western Ocean.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: The Dark Ones will appose you with all their power.

turns.speaker: SEER
turns.text: They will fail for, during the day, the power of the Circle is greater than theirs. Only at night can they pierce the Circle.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Knowledge I wouldn't want.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: No. They are sad, solitary creatures, rarely seen.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: We'll seek an Emerald Seer. They have great powers of vision.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: There's an Emerald Circle a few leagues from here.  We'll find her.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: We can save half a day by crossing the Stone Lake.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Many have perished in that maze.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: No maze to me, my fried. It is where we take refuge when they hunt us.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: The leader of the Dark Ones?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Yes.  Like you, a King. A King of many worlds. All enslaved.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: I must go to the widow. Perhaps she will help.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: The Widow of the Web?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: That creature helps no one. And none who go there return.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: She has the power of vision.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: She has the power to kill.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Perhaps she will not kill me, for I know her name.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Her name is Death.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: She had another name once.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Few have survived it.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Fewer will survive them.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Each to his fate, lad.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Each to his fate. Wait for me at the inn. If I am not back by dawn, you will know my fate, and you must go on without me.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: We must reach the Valley of Reeds before the next dawn.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: It's a hundred leagues from here.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: I'll stay behind and keep them busy.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: It is not necessary. They will not follow.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Yes, they are weakening. It takes great power to maintain the Fortress, and they have expended much.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Kegan!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: It is too late. He has drunk.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Go now.  Quell was wise. He knew that a man cannot ask more of his death than it help his friends.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: That is true.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: Who speaks that name!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Ynyr!

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: It is fifty years since I heard that name.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: It is fifty years since I spoke it to you.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: I was beautiful then.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: The most beautiful woman in the world.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: But you would not stay with me.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Could not. Could not betray the girl to whom I was betrothed.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: She was not as beautiful.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: No, she was not as beautiful.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: She bore you many children?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: We had no children.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: You had a son.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You said nothing. You told me nothing.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: You had left me! I kept silent out of rage.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Where is he? My son.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: I killed him when he was born.  This place is my punishment.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: Do not try your trickery on me!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: It is no trickery.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: Those are reflections.  <u>This</u> is my face!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You see?

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Memory is no trick, it is a power. The power to see.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: Power you have given me. What can my power give you?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Knowledge.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: Of what?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: The Fortress of Krull. When will it come near here?

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: Why must you know?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: There is a girl there. Her name is Lyssa.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: You lie!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Could I lie to you and still see your beauty?

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: A young man seeks her. A young man about the age I was when I met you.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: Tomorrow, the Fortress of Krull will rise with the sun in the Valley of Reeds. But the knowledge is of no use to you. No man has ever escaped the Web. And soon the creature will come for you, even here.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: It will not help.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Then the other Lyssa will share your fate. She will grow old in the Fortress as you have grown old here.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: I cannot stop the sand.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: You cannot stop time. Go now, before it runs out.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You will come with me.

turns.speaker: WIDOW
turns.text: There is sand enough for only one life. Go now, save the other.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: What's that man's name?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Why do you want to know?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: He forgot his money...  My mother's got a pub, behind the corner, and he forgot his money, about 100$.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Huh? I see, but this is the FBI, little girl, and I can't let you in.  But if you leave me his money, I'll give him it myself.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Give me his name, I will mail him.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: OK. Mister Stansfield, Norman STANSFIELD.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...Office 2702.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Yeah... How do you know it?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...I heard he said... That's all... Thanks.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Yeah, pal! And I didn't say anything, I said I don't know you.  But do you know what did she say, that stupid Raphaella?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: She told them you wanted her things and that she wasn't surprised police looked for you! Can you believe it?!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Asshole. But she won't miss anything, that. You'll see.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Good, what are you going to do? Do you come back?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: No... I can't... I got tired. I want to live my way.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: YEAH! I was sure! Come on, tell me! I know him?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Come on, shit, tell me! Is he beautiful?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I can't believe it! "Yes I think"... How she kids me! I can't believe it!  And did he pass your threshold or not?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Well... Did you sleep with him or not?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: No... Not yet.  He's very shy... and very sensitive.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: ...Good...  But what's special in him?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...I don't know... It's true he touches me. I love him.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: ...You moved too, didn't you?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Huh!? Because of the slaughter at your same floor?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...Not at all.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: It's better...  You see, it's my turf, so I don't want contracts I'm not informed about, on my turf.  I'm not opposing, but the least they can do is informing me, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: At a certain moment I thought: maybe Leon would like working on his own? So he makes some little extras?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Dirty work, and I kill no women and no kids.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: That's what I later told myself!  No, Tony, forget Leon! It can't be him, he likes too much his job to make such a slaughter!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Tell me... The money I earn and you keep for me...

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Do you need money?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No... Just to know... Because it's a long time I work... And I never did anything with my money... I should do something.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Pay attention to women, Leon.  They are dangerous, you know?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah... Well... I don't know.. I don't know any.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Listen, think about what you want to do, but don't worry, your money is there and it's safer than in a bank... Banks are robbed every five minutes!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Why can't I have a bank account?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: I'll explain you, Leon: they'll ask you to fill in a lot of forms and you can't write and they'll ask you your job, your employer's name and you can't tell them: My job, I'm a hitman and my employer is Tony, his record is longer than his resturant's menu.  That's why you can't have a bank account!

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Take...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Well, I don't need them...

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Take them, you never know... If you want to have some fun. Take, it's a gift.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: OK, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Here, this is the light scoop for night shooting. There, you fix client's distance... How much to the bench down there in the park?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Huh... 500 meters?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: How can you say it?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Look. When you can see his fingers, it's 50 meters.  When you just see his hands, it's about 80 meters. When you distinguish arms from body, it's 120-130. When you see nothing more than a shape, you don't shoot.  Not very sure. You have one chance out of five to miss.  A contract means getting all chances on your side. 5 out of 5.  You can't miss a client. Never... If the task is delicate or the risk is too big, you double. That is, you insure yourself by another means.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: What, for example?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Well, if the guy is far, in a car, and I know weather is going to be bad, rain for example, I think I would plastic the car, with a remote here. I shoot from the distance and if I miss I plastic.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: What if you can't approach the car or he changes car?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Rocket launcher.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Oh really?  But can you miss the car?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Wow! It's brilliant!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah...  Come on, have a little training.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Who'll I aim at?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Whoever.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: The fat man down there, on the bench.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Perfect.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Good! First shot!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Yeah, but I didn't get him, I got his case and now he's behind the tree. What can I do?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: It's not serious, it's just training. You have to learn from the beginning to hit the target, then, to improve precision, you'll train, but on cardboards.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Now, try a running guy.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: The yellow and pink.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What's up? I don't feel you're concentrated.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Yes, yes...

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: It's incredible! How did you do it?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: There, the guy... How did you do that, without even touching him? Without noise. It's like you put him away... How did you do it?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Five minutes. Keep in front of the window.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Come on, get down!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: You were scared, weren't you?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I was nervous, that's all! Where is the guy?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I killed him... and cut him and ate all of him... I left nothing for you!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: It's strange, being in love... It's the first time for me...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: How do you know it's love, if you've never been in love before?... It may be friendship... or the love you can have with a brother or a father... How can you know?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...Because I feel it.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Mathilda? May I come in?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Why don't you take me with you?... I'm ready, now.  You said I learn very quickly.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Quick doesn't mean "ready". And you can't discuss, we said. Right?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: May I go to the cinema?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: For musicals?  That's part of the job!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No, you can't go out.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You see, five minutes ago you said you loved me and now you hate me... but I prefer this!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I hate you because you depart without kissing me. That's all.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...You can leave whenever you want. I don't refrain you.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...This is what I don't like, you see: you don't refrain me, but at the same time I can't get out!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Not taken.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Too heavy.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Well... Then may you rent me your gear for the day?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I never rent my gear.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: If you knew, Leon...!  I killed one thousand in my head...  And this never disturbed my sleep.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: OK... And if it's you who gets killed?  ...Then?  Talking about other people's death is easy, but what about yours? She's here! She moves around you, and can get you in a thousandth of second. Because it was your day, your hour, your second...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: It's true... But a first contract, it's an exception.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: And... May I kiss you, like in the movies, may this be an exception?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...I'm going to kiss you.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Mathilda, stop, please!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Stop. Everyone is looking.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Of course, so kiss me quickly, or they'll notice us.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...You don't believe me, don't you?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: When I say I love you.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Mathilda, don't resume, please. ....Change subject, OK?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...OK.  I love you anyway.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Mathilda?!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: OK, OK! Excuse me! How old were you when you had your first contract?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...Shit!!  We'd found him. We waited for him to get upstairs and he got out of the window.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: What shall we do?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I think.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Piddle. She smiles and looks for the bathroom. She finds it and is going to go in when she sees the head of a man in the bath, walkman on. She withholds a shout and gets against the wall, without moving. She doesn't dare passing before the open door again to join Leon. In the living room, Leon still thinks.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...Why didn't he close the window?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: It's cool departing this way... warm... music...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: There are better things.  You see the importance of the "moment".  Ten minutes early or late, he'd have seen death. He'd have suffered it.  This way, he already departed. Without knowing.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...I'd like knowing what he's listening to...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...Later.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Mathilda, hadn't you told that bullshit to the receptionist, we'd still be in the hotel, I make you notice.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: That wasn't bullshit, I said we love each other.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah!... Anyway, I don't like hotels. Too much people, everyone's got the key... I don't like it.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...I prefer apartments...  Furthermore, there are always kids in a building. What about getting some friends?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Friends? You're crazy!  In my building, before, they just cared drugs all day and you couldn't get one, or they just cared video games and you couldn't get one, no more.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You're darkening the picture, aren't you?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: A little...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Is there a normal 13 or 14 year old boy?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Yeah... There's a lot on TV.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: It's too big.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Yeah... I'm just good for left-overs!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Risky business, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...You're young, Mathilda... You still have a chance to get out.  You can't give up this chance. You have to protect it. There's a lot of things to do in life, a lot of other jobs...

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: There are just two things I'm interested in: love and death.  For the moment, I have none of the two!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Mathilda... There's equally a lot of other things!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Huh, really? What? Come on, I'm waiting!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No, excuse me... It's the yogurt that made me laugh.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: You've just to love me and I'll be the happiest woman around.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah, I know! But for the moment you're not yet a woman. So, be patient... I need time... And you too. You have to grow up.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I don't grow up any more. I just get older.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I'm here, I'll never leave you again, Mathilda, never. I swear.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I love you so much, Leon.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I love you too, and I don't want to lose you.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Poor darling, and then?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Well... I proposed them to play roulette...  Like we played...  ...And I lost.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Well... I don't know, suddenly, the make up... All this... How are you?  Are you OK?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Of course! I'm fine!  I put on your beautiful dress, I slightly made up...  I tried to get beautiful!  Don't you like it?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...Don't you drink?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I prefer waiting for a while...  I feel it would go the wrong way.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...Don't you like me?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: How many girlfriends did you have?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...I don't know.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Well... 1... 2... 10... 100... 1000? How many, approximately?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...Mathilda, I don't feel like talking about this.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Why? Did you have too many and you fear it may shock me?  I won't get shocked. I'm used to this!  My father was a true pig. He fucked the bitch I'd as mother all around the apartment. Whenever a door was closed, you could be sure they were making sex behind it!  And my sister, if you didn't sleep with her, you're building's exception!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Stop, Mathilda! Don't talk like that!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...I had a girlfriend... A long time ago.  Before coming here, in my country. I was 14-year-old... We flirted like kids...  Her father didn't want her to meet me.  My family was not very respectable.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Then? You didn't give a shit about her father, didn't you?  You met anyway?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...That's awful.  I hope you killed, that asshole?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...Yes. The day he got out of jail. I allowed him to make ten steps... No more. And bang. Two hundred meters. By telescope. That night, I left my country and came here, to join my father, who worked for Tony.  ...I was 17. Then, I never left the city...  And never had another girlfriend...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You... You knock the code, when you come back, OK?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Three times, then two times.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: May I ask you a personal question?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: ...Yes.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: What do you do, with the money you earn?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Nothing, for the moment.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Maybe it's the time to do something, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah, what?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I don't know... Getting far away, the two of us, for example...  And forgetting all this...

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Why did you unleash the pipe, I don't know?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: It will take them five minutes!  How long ago did they arrive?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I don't know... Five minutes.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Good! Snipers can't be in position.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: How shall we get out now, Leon?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Let me work. We'll get out, I tell you!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: No! I don't want to leave you!!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Mathilda, listen!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: No, no! I don't want to go!  I don't want!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: You say it just to calm me!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Not at all, Mathilda! I tell you because it's true! You'll buy the globe you told me about and you will choose, OK? We'll go where you want! I swear, you'll see, Mathilda!!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Good morning, Mister... It's Danielle!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Huh! You made an error, baby.  I don't know any Danielle.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...I got lost, Mister.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Huh? Move back, baby, I can't see anything.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: It's not me, it's dark here... and I can't find the switch.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...Yes?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Excuse me, Mister... I'm looking for Mister Rubens' apartment, but it's dark out here and I got lost...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...One second.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Don't fear.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I have no fear.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: How are you, Miss?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Fine...

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I'm sick with practicing, that's it...

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: I see. You're good, because I didn't hear anything.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Yeah. I put a rag on the strings, to lessen noise.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Huh? That's smart!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: I'm used to it.  Not everyone likes music.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Yeah, true.  But what does your father exactly do for living?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...Composer.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Huh, that's good!

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Yeah, but he's not exactly my father...

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...No... he's my lover...

turns.speaker: THE BOSS
turns.text: You can't sit here like that.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Huh? Why?

turns.speaker: THE BOSS
turns.text: Because you have to pay.  It's like a parking meter: if you stay, you pay. It's the rule...

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: ...And how much is it?

turns.speaker: THE BOSS
turns.text: Ten dollars... A month.

turns.speaker: THE BOSS
turns.text: ...OK... Good.

turns.speaker: MATHILDA
turns.text: Can I sit on the stairways now?

turns.speaker: THE BOSS
turns.text: Huh... Yeah, yeah... Of course.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Rinaldi... Rinaldi...  What region do you come from?

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: Messina.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Emilio? Due grappe!  ...Why the hell did you come here?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: But... He works for your same employer?

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: Yeah, but I don't give a shit about.  I trade at left, at right and that's dangerous in there...

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: It's a little out of the world coming to visit me this way, on mid afternoon.  It really isn't the usual procedure...

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: I know... But I'm a little pressed.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: ...Who sent you?

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: Giancarlo... Rinaldi.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Is he still alive?

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: Yeah... And still in Messina.  He's my uncle.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Huh? Are you Alfredo's son, then?

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: No... Dino's.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Have you ever been in Messina, son?

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: Yes... Twice.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Did you fish in Messina? The "pesce spada"?

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: It's a specialty down there.  It's a fishing boat with, in front, a long pole near the surface. Then, near the cabin, a very tall mast with a little cabin for the lookout.

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: I think I will get back in Messina this summer... It's too long I haven't been there.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: You're right, son. You must care the links with your family, always.  It's the only important thing in the world.

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: ...Yeah.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Salute.

turns.speaker: RINALDI
turns.text: Salute.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: You'd better talk good, son, because, for the moment, I've got a quite bad opinion about you.  Norman smiles.

turns.speaker: STANSFIELD
turns.text: I respect your business, Mister Tony. Every time we asked your help, we were very happy with the result.  It's right this that makes me nervous, now.  I hope you'll excuse my temporary bad mood?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Then...

turns.speaker: STANSFIELD
turns.text: Do you recognize him?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: ...Even his mother wouldn't.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Listen, son, you know as well as me this kind of hitmen: they come from nowhere, get the contract and disappear. They're lonely, worse than wolves.

turns.speaker: STANSFIELD
turns.text: May we have this wolf's name and address?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: These guys have no place.  They change virtually everyday. And his name...  It's a surname.

turns.speaker: GERALD
turns.text: He probably just went somewhere.

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: GERALD
turns.text: For a walk.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: GERALD
turns.text: Adelle... Maurice is in the paper.

turns.speaker: GERALD
turns.text: This smells good.

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: Why am I such an authority?

turns.speaker: GERALD
turns.text: Here comes the resume.

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: I received my B.S. from the University of Pennsylvania, my P.H.D. from Bryn Mawr College.  I worked three years at the Boston University School of Medicine, during which time I had articles printed in the "Journal of Educational Psychology", "American Journal of Psychology", "Psychology Review" and "Science"... So I think it's safe to say my opinion is valid.
